column1: Master of Science in Chemical and Energy Engineering
column2: The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology
column3: School of Engineering - Taught Postgraduate Programs
column5: The backbone of Master of Science program in Chemical and Energy Engineering (CEE) is made up of energy, environment and nanotechnology, three of the key areas of chemical engineering for which HKUST has built its global reputation. Moreover, the program enables students to hone their understanding of and expertise in product development, material sciences, energy conversion and utilization, renewable energies, power generation, carbon neutrality, and sustainable development.
column7: 2024/25 Fall intake - Full-time students: HK$170,500 (~US$21,900) - paid in 2 installments - Part-time students: HK$148,500 (~US$19,100) - paid in 4 installments  For other fees, please visit the university website.
